notes: Strain into rocks glass w/ large cube

reference: Boothby, William. (1908). _World's Drinks and How to Mix Them._

reference: Boothby, William. (1908). *World's Drinks and How to Mix Them.* Solon, Johnnie (bartender). Big Brass Rail, Waldorf-Astoria Hotel, New York.

notes: Coupe or rocks glass w/ ice

notes: Can substitute with Cynar and Gran Classico.

notes: Muddle the grapefruit peel before stirring.

reference: Miller, Brian. Death + Co, New York (2009).

Add a long cucumber peel for garnish

reference: Embury, David. (1948). *Fine Art of Mixing Drinks, The.*

name: Honey Bee
reference: Embury, David. (1948). *The Fine Art of Mixing Drinks*

reference: Day, Alex. (2018). _Cocktail Codex_. Death + Co, New York.

Add rest, add pebble ice, swizzle, add pebble ice

reference: *Sloppy Joe's*. (1931). Ngiam Tong Boon (bartender), Long Bar, Raffles Hotel, Singapore, 1915.

notes: Rocks glass w/ ice or coupe

reference: Gaige, Crosby. (1945). *Cocktail Guide and Ladies' Companion.*

name: Smuggler’s Cove Mai Tai
reference: Cate, Martin. (2000s). Smuggier's Cove, San Francisco.
notes: Shake w/ crushed ice, pour unstrained into rocks glass
Garnish w/ spent lime hull & a mint sprig

name: Corn 'n Oil
notes: Build in rocks glass w/ ice.

name: Pisco Sour
reference: Baker, Jr, Charles H., (1951). *South American Gentleman's Companion, The.*
notes: Garnish with 4 dashes of Angostura bitters

name: Jungle Bird
reference: Ross, Sam. (2012) Milk + Honey, New York.

name: Caipirinha
notes: Cut 1/2 of a lime into wedges, then muddle w/ 2 demerara sugar cubes and shake, pour unstrained into rocks glass

name: Barbados
reference: Rathbun, A.J. (2011). *Ginger Bliss and The Violet Fizz*.

name: Monkey Gland
reference: McElhone, Harry. (1922). *ABC of Mixing Cocktails.* Ciro's Club, London.

name: Moscow Mule

name: Paloma
notes: Build in salt-rimmed Collins glass w/ ice

name: Seelbach
reference: Haigh, Ted. (2003). *Vintage Spirits and Forgotten Cocktails.* Seelbach Hotel Bar, Louisville, 1917.

name: Mojito
reference: Lasa, Juan A. (1929). *Libro de Cocktail.* "Rum Mojo" (orig).
notes: Muddle mint w/ syrup in mixing glass
Fine-strain into Collins glass w/ ice

name: Death in the Afternoon
reference: Hemingway, Ernest. (1935) "Death in the Afternoon". *So Red the Nose, or Breath in the Afternoon.*

name: Jimmie Roosevelt
notes: Shake cognac, chartreuse, bitters w/ ice

name: El Diablo
notes: Strain into rocks glass w/ ice

reference: deBary, John. (2009, Fall). PDT, New York.
